modules.description: Provides functions to enable or disable terminal attributes by name and control color output. Operates on string attribute names and a boolean for color state. Used to toggle bold, underline, or color rendering in terminal output.

Provides functions to parse, generate, and manipulate text-based tag structures, including adding, removing, and querying tags within a string. Operates on custom tag records and tagged string representations. Used to implement inline metadata tagging in document processing workflows.

Controls text formatting in strings using tag-based syntax, supporting both terminal and HTML output. It defines tags with attributes using S-expressions and allows manipulation of terminal styles like bold, underline, and color via attribute names. Functions enable or disable these styles dynamically, altering how text is rendered in different modes. For example, @{bold@}Hello@{bold@} produces bold text in terminal mode, while in HTML mode it wraps text in <b> tags.
